1.str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

1.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
1.str2: Or apothomai ap-o'-thom-ahee from apo and the middle voice of otheo or otho; to push off, figuratively, to reject.

1.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Apparently a primary word; a people.

1.str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.

1.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

1.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
1.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
An Israelite, one of the chosen people of Israel, a Jew. From Israel; an 'Israelite', i.e. Descendant of Israel.
From speiro; something sown, i.e. Seed; by implication, offspring; specially, a remnant.
Abraham, progenitor of the Hebrew race. Of Hebrew origin; Abraham, the Hebrew patriarch.
A tribe or race of people. From phuo; an offshoot, i.e. Race or clan.
Benjamin, youngest son of Jacob, founder of one of the twelve tribes of Israel. Of Hebrew origin; Benjamin, an Israelite.

2.str2: A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

2.str2: Or apothomai ap-o'-thom-ahee from apo and the middle voice of otheo or otho; to push off, figuratively, to reject.

The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(a) a writing, (b) a passage of scripture; plur: the scriptures. A document, i.e. Holy Writ.

2.str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Elijah, the prophet. Of Hebrew origin; Helias, an Israelite.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

2.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
2.str2: From en and tugchano; to chance upon, i.e. confer with; by extension to entreat.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
Of Hebrew origin; Israel, the adopted name of Jacob, including his descendants.

3.str2: Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

3.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
3.str2: To put to death, kill; fig: I abolish. From apo and kteino; to kill outright; figuratively, to destroy.

3.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From a compound of pro and phemi; a foreteller; by analogy, an inspired speaker; by extension, a poet.

3.str2: To dig down under, demolish, undermine. From kata and skapto; to undermine, i.e. destroy.

3.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
An altar (for sacrifice). From a derivative of thusia; a place of sacrifice, i.e. An altar.

3.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
3.str2: To also, I too, but I. From kai and ego; so also the dative case kamoi, and accusative case kame and I, me.
Only, solitary, desolate. Probably from meno; remaining, i.e. Sole or single; by implication, mere.

3.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 1st Person Singular
3.str2: To leave behind; pass: To be left surviving. From hupotrecho and leipo; to leave under, i.e. to remain.

3.str2: To seek, search for, desire, require, demand. Of uncertain affinity; to seek; specially, to worship, or to plot.

3.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From psucho; breath, i.e. spirit, abstractly or concretely.

4.str2: But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

4.str2: From kata and leipo; to leave down, i.e. Behind; by implication, to abandon, have remaining.
